alert.note: Alert for Greenwood; Newberry; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 1:07PM EST until January 14 at 9:30AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Saluda River At Chappells affecting Newberry, Greenwood and Saluda Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saluda River at Chappells. * WHEN...Until late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Lowlands around and downstream from Chappells become flooded. Cattle grazing river bottomland should be moved to higher ground. At 16.0 feet, Extensive farmland and river bottomland around and downstream from Chappells become flooded. At 18.0 feet, The Saluda River Campground including the Campground Store downstream from Chappells becomes flooded. Campers should move to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM EST Friday the stage was 18.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:15 PM EST Friday was 20.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 9.7 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 115 AM EST.
